Description: Head veil; Rectangle (incomplete) of open weave undyed linen (a), with a rolled pad (b) – the head band – sewn to the centre of one long side. (a) The main cloth has a plain fringe at the complete end and decorative bands of thicker weft. Warp: S-spun linen, ca 8 ends/cm Weft: S-spun linen, ca 8 picks/cm Edges: one fringe, two (?) selvedges, otherwise fragmentary. Sewing threads: (a) is sewn to (b) with S-spun unbleached linen thread. (b) curved padded roll, roughly made from undyed linen cloth, with grouped weft bands, rolled around a core of tow (linen waste) and bound with 14 sewn-on glass beads of various colours including millefiore. Warp: S-spun linen, ca 14 threads/cm Weft: S-spun linen, ca 13 threads/cm Edges: torn or hidden Sewing threads: thread binding roll in S-spun linen; thread attaching beads in S-spun Z-ply linen; running stitch
Curator's comments: History of use: size suggests it belongs to a girl rather than a woman. The cloth used for roll was almost certainly second-hand.
Condition: Fragmentary; fair; some beads missing. Iron mould probably derives from modern pins.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
